info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 12 at 9:33AM MDT until April 13 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning now in effect until 8 PM today for very strong winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 222, and 226 through 230, which includes El Paso, Pueblo, Fremont, Huerfano, and western Las Animas Counties... ...Red Flag Warning now in effect until 8 PM today for very strong winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 221, 224, 225, and 231 through 237, which includes portions of the southeast plains, Teller County, the southeast mountains, and the San Luis Valley... ...Fire Weather Watch remains in effect for Wednesday afternoon and evening for strong winds and low humidity value for fire weather zones 227, 228, and 230 through 237 which includes most of the plains in southeast Colorado. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 227...228 AND 230... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 227...228 AND 230... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 227...228 and 230. * Winds...West 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
